text: The Yamuna (), sometimes called Jamuna (, , ) or Jumna, is a major river in North India. It is the largest branch of a bigger river called the Ganges. It is 1370 km long. It begins at the Yamunotri, which is in the Himalayas. It goes through the Indian states of Delhi, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh. At the end, it flows into the Ganges. Rivers that come out of the Yamuna include the Tons (the largest of the ones that come out of it), Chambal, Betwa, and Ken ==Gallery== File:YamunaRiver.jpg|AyYamuna as seen from the Taj Mahal, Agra. File:Madan Mohan temple, on the Yamuna, Vrindavan, 1789.jpg|Madan Mohan temple, on the Yamuna, Vrindavan, 1789, it has shifted further away since then. File:Keshighat Vrindavan.JPG|'Keshi Ghat' on the Yamuna, Vrindavan. File:Yamuna_River_Near_Allahabad.jpg|Yamuna near Allahabad, just few kilometers before it meets the Ganges. File:Yamuna_river,_Allahabad.jpg|Yamuna near Allahabad in the rainy season. ==Related pages== * List of rivers of India ==References== ==Other websites== *The Geography of the Rigveda * Yamuna Action Plan Category:Rivers of India
title: Yamuna
